title: Tranferring Data
text:
We recommend two different approaches for transferring data to and from the cluster.
Each are most suitable for different situations. We explain the usage of each tool below.

title: Tranferring Data
text:
Secure Copy
Secure copy is ideal for transferring small amounts of data and is much simpler to use than Globus connect. A secure copy can be performed with the scp command. This command can only be used to transfer data to and from the transfer node transfer.cam.uchc.edu.
The required syntax for scp is:
scp <src> <dest>
The src and dest arguments specify file or directory paths.
Any remote file path must be prefixed with a user ID along with the transfer node address and separated from the path with a colon like so:
<user>@<hostname>:.
In order to secure copy a directory use the -r option.

Transfer Host
Using scp is only permitted on the transfer
High availability transfer node: haxfer.cam.uchc.edu


Examples
Copy a file from your local computer to your home directory on the cluster:
scp <local path> <user>@transfer.cam.uchc.edu:<remote path>
Copy a directory from the cluster to your local computer:
scp -r <user>@transfer.cam.uchc.edu:<remote path> <local path>

Home Directory
Path: /home/FCAM/<user>
All user automatically receive a home directory when their account is created.
Intended for storage of small files such as scripts, source code, and software installtion. Can accomodate a small amount of data.
Quota: 1TB
Data are backed up by snapshots

title: UConn HPC
text:
Lab
Path: /labs/<name>
Intended for data that needs to be accessed by multiple users
Quota: 2TB, can be increased upon request
Backed up.

title: Connecting to cluster
text:
In order to connect to cluster, you must use an SSH client. See below for instructions based on your operating system.


The cluster can be accessed through the host url:
mantis-submit.cam.uchc.edu
You can login through this host if you are connected to most networks at the University of Connecticut or Univeristy of Connecticut Health center or if you are connected to the Cam VPN.
This url will redirect you to one of these host urls:

mantis-sub-1.cam.uchc.edu
mantis-sub-2.cam.uchc.edu
mantis-sub-3.cam.uchc.edu
mantis-sub-4.cam.uchc.edu




The cluster can be accessed through login.hpc.cam.uchc.edu from any network (on/off campus, with/without VPN) but requires that you setup an ssh key.




Mac and Linux UsersWindows Users


An ssh client is installed by default on Mac and Linux operating sytems and can be run from the Terminal App.
Login with

title: Request an Account
text:
Request an Account
In order to access the cluster, you must first create an account.

Submit an account request ticket.
Select New Account Request from the Request Type dropdown menu.
Choose HPC Cluster Account as the Account Type.
Fill in all required fields and click submit.



Passwords
Upon approval of an account request you will need to enroll in the CAM Password Manager and reset your password.
Passwords expire every 90 days.
Anytime you need to reset your password, you can do so in the CAM Password Manager.
